_header: Whoso woneth him not to good first all in his youth
Note:
Cf. 1867, and Walther (1963)
XWalther, Hans. Proverbia sententiaque latinitatis medii aevi. 6 vols. Göttingen, 1963-69, 24381.
_description: A tag in the Fascicu1us morum, translating two Latin hexameters, Qui non assuescit virtuti dum iuenescit, A viciis nescit discedere quanto sensecit, which precede it

BodLauMis111.Transcription:
Wo so wouch woneth hym nouth to gode frust al in is
                    ȝoutheVnthewes to leue were to hym in helde ful vnkwthe
BodLauMis111.Editions:
Wenzel,  Siegfried. 
             Verses in Sermons: ‘Fasciculus morum’ and Its Middle
                English Poems.
         Cambridge, MA: Medieval Academy of America, 1978: 145.

CamStJohn159.Note:
Not listed in Wenzel (1974)
XWenzel,  Siegfried. 
             “The English Verses in the Fasciculus Morum.” 
             Chaucer and Middle English Studies in Honour of Rossell Hope
                Robbins.
            
                
                    Beryl
                    Rowland
                
            
         London: Allen & Unwin, 1974: 230-48.

EDU82.Transcription:
Who so woneth hym not to good first in his ȝowtheVnnethe to leve
                    were to hym in age full vnkouthe

Lincoln44.Transcription:
he þat wones hym noght to gode al hiis yowþe furst in ys
                    ȝoutheyuel þewes to leue wer to hym in hylde ful
                    vnlathe

WorcF19.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild. 
             A Register of Middle English Religious & Didactic Verse.
         2 vols. London: Oxford University Press for the Bibliographical
            Society: 1916-20: 1.45.
